Name: China
Description:
The  victim  was  a  sex  worker.  There  are  two  hypotheses:  the  victim was murdered or it was a suicide.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: El Mercurio, 02.04.2010

Name: Toni Alston
Description:
Toni was shot in front of her home.

>  She had worked at a nearby Family Dollar store and had recently been promoted to manager, her sisters said. They described her as a workaholic who was liked by everyone. Charlotte-Mecklenburg police homicide detective Bill Ward said Toni often helped local homeless people and was well liked in her neighborhood.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: Charlotte Observer,14.04.2010

Description:

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The  victim’s body was found by a group of children in an abandoned house, naked and with her mouth gagged with her own underwear. Her body was bruised and she had been stabbed.

An activist of Associação de Travesti da Paraíba (ASTRAPA) declared that there were  clear signs that the crime was motivated by homophobia.

TvT Partner Organization: Grupo Gay da Bahia (Tabelas 2010)

Name: Ashley Santiago Ocasio
Description:
Ashley's naked body was found in the kitchen of her apartment. She had been stabbed 14 times.

"Activists press authorities to probe the slaying as a possible hate crime". "The grisly scene at Santiago's home raised suspicion  that  she  may  have  been  targeted  because  of  her  gender identity".  "The  case  has  grabbed  headlines  and  renewed  complaints that  Puerto  Rico  has  never  invoked  a  2002  hate  crime  law  covering crimes based on sexual orientation or gender identity".

Ashley owned a Beauty Salon. 

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: Associated Press (news agency), 25.04.2010

Name: Azra
Description:
Azra was shot in the back of the head. She was a founding member of the  Black Pink Triangle Izmir LGBTT Association.

> Azra, the first member of Black Pink, was killed just as Black Pink was finally brought before the court. Eventually, on the third hearing, the judge announced the decision in favor of Black Pink with these words: "Like other citizens, lesbians, gays, bisexuals, and transgender people have a right to create associations. For this reason, the case is dismissed."
> 
> Black Pink has thus experienced two contradictory events in one week; the loss of one of its founding members as well as its formal recognition as an organization. Black Pink dedicates its legal victory to the memory of Azra. We will start operating as a registered group to end hate crimes and discrimination. We will have a long and difficult journey ahead of us, but know that fighting for respect for our communities is as important now as ever.
> 
> Rest in peace, Azra.

"Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide" research project: Pembehayat (Pink Life), Ankara

http://iglhrc.wordpress.com/2010/05/03/recognition-of-an-organization-and-the-loss-of-a-leader/

Name: Renata
Location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro
